column2: Variablenbeschreibung
This variable lists the name of the federal state of the Federal Republic of Germany. The Federal Republic of Germany is divided into 16 federal states.

Die Variable Verantwortliches Ministerium This variable lists the ministry of the respective federal state that is responsible for the area of Open Access / Open Science/Digitization in that federal state.das Ministerium des jeweiligen Bundeslandes auf, welches für den Bereich Open Access / Open Science/Digitalisierung im Bundesland zuständig ist.
This URL variable lists the link that leads to the home page of the respective ministry.
This variable describes whether OA is mentioned in the coalition agreement of the current (as of May 2021) governing coalition and retrospective coalitions in the respective federal state.
This variable shows the URL to the current (as of May 2021) coalition agreement of the respective federal state , in which Open Access is mentioned.
column9: The value 1 is assigned if a variable is answered positively (=yes).

column2: This variable displays the text excerpt from the current coalition agreement in which OA is mentioned.
column9: The value 0 is assigned if a variable is answered negatively (=no)

column2: This variable displays the link to a past coalition agreement of the respective state in which OA is mentioned.
column9: The value NA (not available) is assigned if the search shows that no information is available.

column2: This variable displays the text excerpt of a past coalition agreement of the respective federal state in which OA is mentioned.
This variable indicates whether each ministry has published its own strategy/policy/guideline on Open Access.
column9: Relevant free text is taken from the mentioned source

column1: Art der OA-Positionierung: Policy Strategie Leitlinie: Titel
column2: This variable names the title of the respective document, in which the federal state positions itself toward Open Access.
This variable shows the URL to the document of the respective Open Access positioning of the respective federal state
This variable indicates whether OA is mentioned in the higher education law of the respective state.
This variable contains the URL to the higher education law of the respective state in which OA is mentioned.
This variable shows the text excerpt from the Higher Education Act of the respective federal state in which Open Access is mentioned. If there is a page number in the cited document, it is indicated.
This variable indicates whether OA is specified in the respective state of a form of higher education governance.

column1: OA in der Hochschulsteuerung: Titel 1. Ziel- und Leistungsvereinbarungen auf Länderebene
column2: This variable shows the title of the respective document of the target and performance agreement at country level in which OA is mentioned.
This variable shows the URL of the document of the target and performance agreement on the country level, in which Open Access is mentioned.

column1: OA in der Hochschulsteuerung: Titel 2-3. Ziel- und Leistungsvereinbarung auf Einrichtungsebene
column2: This variable shows the titles of the respective documents of the target and performance agreements at institutional level in which OA is mentioned.
This variable shows the URL of the respective documents of the target and performance agreements at institution level in which OA is mentioned.

column1: OA in der Hochschulsteuerung: Titel 4-6. Hochschulentwirklungsverträge und Wissenschaftspläne auf Länderebene
column2: This variable shows the titles of the respective documents of the higher education development agreements or science plans at the state level in which OA is mentioned.
This variable shows the URL of the respective documents of the higher education development contracts or science plans on the country level in which Open Access is mentioned.

column1: OA in der Hochschulsteuerung: Titel 7. Digitalisierungsstrategien
column2: This variable shows the titles of the respective digital strategy documents at country level in which OA is mentioned.
This variable shows the URL of the respective digital strategy documents at country level in which OA is mentioned.
This variable describes whether there is or was a political support program in the respective state.
This variable designates the title of the political support program in the respective state.
This variable names the website or document link to the policy support program in the state.
This variable specifies the amount with which the political support program is financed in the respective state.
This variable indicates whether there is funding for OA at the state level in the respective state.
This variable indicates the format for which this funding is valid. You can choose between book, magazine or mixed.
This variable shows the URL to the respective web page where information about the funding can be found.
This variable shows the amount of money a country fund is endowed with.
This variable shows the URL to the web page where information about the financial endowment to the state fund can be found.
This variable indicates whether there are further strategies for specific fields of action in the OA field in the respective federal state.
This variable indicates the title of the state strategy that exists in the respective state for a specific field of action in OA.
This variable specifies the URL to the website or document of the state strategy that exists in the respective state for a specific field of action in OA.
This variable indicates whether there are central state institutions in the respective state that are responsible for OA.
This variable specifies the title of the state institution responsible for OA in the respective state.
This variable specifies the link to the website of the state institution responsible for OA in the respective state.
This variable indicates whether the respective federal state promotes infrastructures in the area of open access.
This variable designates the title of the infrastructure supported by the respective state.
This variable designates the URL to the website with info about the infrastructure supported by the respective state.
This variable designates the sum with which the infrastructure supported by the respective federal state is financed.
This variable indicates whether the respective state has set its own OA quota.
This variable indicates how high the open access quota is for the respective state.
This variable specifies the URL to information about the open access quota for the respective state.
This variable indicates whether there is central open access monitoring in the respective state.
This variable specifies the URL to the web page or document where information on open access monitoring can be found.
This variable indicates whether the state funds some form of incentive through contests, prizes, or the like for OA.
This variable indicates the title of the incentive program.
This variable specifies the link to the web page or document that contains information about the particular incentive program.
This variable indicates whether the respective federal state promotes networks in the area of OA.

column1: Förderung von und für Netzwerke 1: Name
column2: This variable indicates the title of the network that is supported by the respective federal state in the area of OA

column1: Förderung von und für Netzwerke 1: URL
column2: This variable specifies the URL of the network that is supported by the respective federal state in the area of Open Access
This variable indicates whether the respective federal state promotes competence centers in the area of OA.
This variable indicates the title of the competence center that the respective federal state promotes in the area of OA.
This variable specifies the URL to the competence center that the respective federal state promotes in the area of OA.
This variable indicates whether the respective federal state supports working groups, e.g. of OA officers.
This variable names the title of the OA working group funded by the respective state.
This variable names the URL to information about the OA working group funded by the respective state.
This variable names whether there are forms of networking in the area of OA at the state level.
This variable names the title of the form of networking at the state level in the area of OA.
This variable names the URL to the web page or document that contains information about the networking form at the state level in OA.

column1: Länderübergreifende Zusammenarbeit zur Förderung von OA
column2: This variable indicates whether there is a cross-country form of networking in the area of Open Access, for example Open Access exchange between federal states and the BMBF.
This variable denotes the form of cross-national exchange in the field of OA.
This variable specifies the URL to the web page or document where information about cross-country exchange in OA can be obtained.
This variable indicates whether there are projects associated with OA in the respective state.
This variable identifies projects associated with open access by subject area, including open source; open data; open educational resources; research data.
This variable names the projects associated with OA by project title in each state.
This variable names the URL to the web page with information about the project associated with OA in each state.
This variable indicates whether open access best practices exist in the state.
This variable names the title of the respective best practice in OA in the respective state.
This variable names the URL to the respective best practice in OA in the respective state.
Diese Variable gibt den Textauszug aus dem Länder-Dossier zur jeweiligen Best Practice im Bereich Open Access im jeweiligen Bundesland an.
This variable designates in which year the political elections in the respective state take place or have taken place.

column1: Die Linke - Open Access im Parteiprogramm
column2: This variable indicates whether The Left Party (Die Linke) names OA in its current election program.
This variable names the URL to the party program of The Left Party (Die Linke) in the respective federal state.
This variable specifies the text excerpt in which Open Access is named in the party program of The Left Party (Die Linke). If there is a page reference, this is also named.
This variable indicates whether the Social Democratic Party for Germany (SPD) party names OA in its current election program.
This variable designates the link to the party program of the SPD in the respective federal state.
This variable specifies the text excerpt in which Open Access is named in the SPD party program. If there is a page reference, this is also named.

column1: Bündnis 90/Die Grünen - Open Access im Parteiprogramm
column2: This variable indicates whether the Green Party (Bündnis 90/Die Grünen) names OA in its current election program.
This variable designates the link to the party program of Bündnis 90/Die Grünen in the respective federal state.
This variable specifies the text excerpt in which Open Access is mentioned in the party program of Bündnis 90/Die Grüne. If there is a page reference, this is also named.
This variable indicates whether the Christian Democratic Union (CDU) names OA in its current election program.
This variable designates the link to the party program of the CDU in the respective federal state.
This variable specifies the text excerpt in which Open Access is named in the CDU party program. If there is a page reference, this is also named.
This variable indicates whether the Free Democratic Party (FDP) party names OA in its current election program.
This variable designates the link to the party program of the FDP in the respective federal state.
This variable specifies the text excerpt in which Open Access is named in the party program of the FDP. If there is a page reference, this is also named.

column1: Länder-Dossier Textauszug 1: Kurzer Abriss: Historie und Stand der Aktivitäten
column2: This variable shows the text excerpt on the topic of history and status of activities from the country dossier for the respective federal state.
This variable shows the text excerpt on the topic of framework conditions from the country dossier for the respective federal state.

column1: Länder-Dossier Textauszug 3: Aktivitäten und Maßnahmen zur Förderung von Open Access
column2: This variable shows the text excerpt on the topic of activities and measures to promote OA from the state dossier for the respective federal state.
This variable shows the text excerpt on the topic of networking activities from the country dossier for the respective federal state.
This variable shows the text excerpt on the Associated Topics topic from the country dossier for the respective federal state.
